column4: I have a Windows 7 set up in Raid 0, I want to install Ubuntu but don't care if it's in Raid, can I install it to a 3rd drive without loss of any Windows files and still be able to dual boot both?
you can remove your raided drives and plug in that 3rd one and install ubuntu as if theres only drive in the system, then plug windows drives back in and use bios to choose which hdd to boot
yea its a little awkward solution but it works, otherwise to boot windows you'd have to install grub to the windows hdd and i dont know how your raid is going to like it
